name: Antiviral Resistance Detection
description: Identification of Antiviral Drug Resistance-Associated Substitutions in NGS Clinical Trial Data
_usability_domain: Identify baseline single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs), insertions, and deletions that correlate with reduced ledipasvir antiviral drug efficacy in Hepatitus C virus subtype 1
Identify treatment emergent amino acid substitutions that correlate with antiviral drug treatment failure
Determine whether the treatment emergent amino acid substitutions identified correlate with treatment failure involving other drugs against the same virus

name: HIVE-Viral Mutation Detection Pipeline
description: HIVE-Viral Mutation Detection uses two HIVE tools: Hexagon for alignment and Heptagon for variant calling. Only the options that need to be selected or changed are listed.

name: antiviral_resistance_pipeline
description: This pipeline uses an aligner and then a profiler to detect possible mutations involved in drug resistance.

subject.description: reference sequences can be either FASTA from known sources or identifiers from HIVE database. These must be saved as a 'genome' type in HIVE to use in this field
subject.name: Reference Sequencs

query.description: sequences can be either FASTA from experimental sources or identifiers from HIVE database. These must be saved as a 'nuc_read' type in HIVE to use in this field
query.name: Nucleotide Read

svc-align-hexagon.description: Non-default arguments for the alignment, HIVE Hexagon
svc-align-hexagon.name: HIVE Hexagon Alignment Engine

svc-profiler-heptagon.description: arguments for the engine to perform coverage analysis, base-calling, SNP calling
svc-profiler-heptagon.name: Sequence Profiling Engine

snv_profile.description: The output file containing the SNP Profile
snv_profile.name: SNPProfile Output File

alignment_file.description: The resulting alignment file from the Hexagon computation
alignment_file.name: Alignement File

aminoacid_calls.description: the amino acid calls from Heptagon
aminoacid_calls.name: Amino Acid Calls

name: pipeline_definition
description: This type defines the elements that can be present in the pipeline_definition objects.  pipeline_definition objects list all of the system information and tools needed to execute an established pipeline.

system.description: The system field is for listing all system OS versions as well as hardware requirements and settings.

tool_used.description: This feild is for describing all information about the specific bioinformatic tools used. name and version fields are present, as well as the argument field. The argument field is a plural field and should be used for each individual argument of each tool.

name: base_biocompute_type
description: Provides the base fields to populate in a biocompute object

verification.description: Describes the position of an object in the verification process. The unreviewed flag indicates that the object has been submitted, but no further curation has occurred. The in_progress flag indicates that verification is underway. manual indicates that the object has been manually validated. The suspended flag indicates an object that was once valid is no longer considered valid. The error flag indicates that an error was detected with the biocompute object.

usability_domain.description: Provides a space for the author to define the usability domane of an object.

pipeline.description: defines the fields that have to be populated for a tool description in the pipeline of a biocompute object

name: verification
description: Definition of the base metadata type providing fields for the inclusion of outside links, submissions, and information pertinent to the experiment but not critical for the computation.

creation_date.description: The time and date that the object is created/computation was run

modification_date.description: This field will list all the dates and time an object ismodified.

publication_status.description: This is a choice field with four options. The draft flag indicates that an object is in draft form and is still being added to or changed. The open access flag indicates that an object has been published and is freely available to anyone. The objects with the private flag have restrictions on who can view and access them. This is a way for researchers using restricted data or metadata to insure the confidentially is maintained.

authors.description: This is the list of authors submitting this object. First and last name are required, middle name and affiliation are not. The affiliation field is for listing the academic, governmental, or private entity that supported the project responsible for generating the biocompute object.

keywords.description: Keywords to aid in search-ability and description of the object. These are a controlled vocabulary.
